title: Supply Chain Management Leader BROWZ Awarded Membership in Prestigious Campbell Institute
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/21/2015 @ 3:00 AM   BROWZ 
BROWZ has been selected as the most recent member of the Campbell Institute; fellow alumni include the world's most respected global brands 
SALT LAKE CITY, Sept. 21, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The Campbell Institute at the National Safety Council has selected BROWZ to join the prestigious ranks of its membership. The Campbell Institute is comprised of the world's leading performers of Environmental Health and Safety. These organizations include AECOM, BNSF, Chevron, Cummins, Dow, ExxonMobil, FLUOR, General Motors, Georgia-Pacific, Johnson Controls, Microsoft, Norfolk Southern, Potash, United Parcel Service, United Technologies, U.S. Steel, and Whirlpool. 
https://photos.prnewswire.com/prnvar/20150920/268565LOGO 
"We are proud to welcome BROWZ to the Campbell Institute," said Deborah A.P. Hersman, president and CEO of the National Safety Council. "Since 2001, BROWZ has been raising the bar on safety, providing assurance that the world's leading organizations are hiring, safe and qualified contractors and suppliers . At the Campbell Institute, BROWZ joins other world-class companies to share their expertise, knowledge, and best practices related to environmental, health, and safety excellence." 
Campbell Institute companies understand that Environment, Health and Safety (EHS) is at the core of business vitality and fundamental to operational and financial performance. The Campbell Institute seeks to help organizations of all sizes and sectors achieve and sustain excellence. 
Elaine Beitler, Chief Executive Officer of BROWZ, said, "The Campbell Institute and the National Safety Council are recognized as the premier thought leaders in EHS. We are excited to be included as members of such a select group and caliber of organizations. Safety management is at the core of our solution, and I believe it's because of our commitment to safety and the expertise of our team that the world's leading organizations select BROWZ to qualify and manage their supply chains. We look forward to sharing our expertise and partnering with these other great companies to provide global safety leadership." 
Using the industry's only patented technology, BROWZ assists enterprise organizations in contractor prequalification and supply chain management . Among key assessments, BROWZ evaluates organizations using a combination of leading and lagging indicators including safety management system audits as overseen by Pat Cunningham, BROWZ Safety Director and Delegate to the National Safety Council. To learn more visit www.browz.com .
